pkgmetadata.longdescription: Efficient Sequential Testing with Evidence Ratios // An implementation of sequential testing that uses evidence ratios computed from the weights of a set of models. These weights correspond either to Akaike weights computed from the Akaike Information Criterion (AIC) or the Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC) and following Burnham Anderson (2004, doi:10.1177/0049124104268644) recommendations, or to pseudo-BMA weights computed from the WAIC or the LOO-IC of models fitted with 'brms' and following Yao et al. (2017, arXiv:1704.02030v3).
